an7.35:4.1: “Mendicants, tonight a god … said to me:
an7.35:4.2: ‘Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an7.35:4.4: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for samādhi; being easy to correct, and good friendship.
an7.35:4.5: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.’
an7.35:4.6: That is what that god said.
an7.35:4.7: Then he bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right side, before vanishing right there.”
an7.35:5.1: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta asked the Buddha:
an7.35:5.2: “Sir, this is how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.
an7.35:5.3: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher and praises such respect.
an7.35:5.4: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.
an7.35:5.5: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:5.10: They are personally easy to correct …
an7.35:5.11: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.
an7.35:5.12: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.
an7.35:5.13: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:5.14: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
an7.35:6.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
an7.35:6.3: It’s when a mendicant personally respects the Teacher …
an7.35:6.4: And they encourage other mendicants who lack such respect to respect the Teacher.
an7.35:6.5: And they praise other mendicants who respect the Teacher at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:6.10: They are personally easy to correct …
an7.35:6.11: They personally have good friends, and praise such friendship.
an7.35:6.12: And they encourage other mendicants who lack good friends to develop good friendship.
an7.35:6.13: And they praise other mendicants who have good friends at the right time, truthfully and substantively.
an7.35:6.14: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.”
